content:
The revised 2024 Status and Progress  shows that we now have just about 5 pages left.

These pages were recently completed:

  • Routes Tab DONE Spiv

  • Route Properties DONE Spiv 5/29

  • Tracks TabDONE Mermike

  • Track PropertiesDONE Mermike

  • Use TracksDONE Mermike

  • Navigation Data Backup DONE Rick 5/31

Just a little more work needed.

  • IntercommunicationsGood but needs some work Rick John

  • Use GPX FilesHold John, Good but Needs some additional work

These are the pages that need more Editing.

  • Use Routes Needs Work Rick,5/27, Mermike 5/29 split route, 3 minor  Needs integration of new material from route properties.  This needs some reorganization of the examples, other improvements.

  • Waypoint-Marks Tab

  • Waypoint Properties

  • Use Waypoint Marks

  • Layers TabEditing in progress sailor1026

Who will help finish these last few pages, please!

Thanks,

Rick

@Manfred Radmacher advised that he would (try) to complete

  • Waypoint-Marks Tab

  • Waypoint Properties

  • Use Waypoint Marks

Manfred does a great job and this is much appreciated. I hope everyone will help him as best they can because these are important pages. ... I will too, but he is the lead on those pages.

Now we just need someone to take on Layers TabEditing in progress sailor1026
if sailor2026 has finished???

In addition to

Layers TabEditing in progress sailor1026
if sailor2026 has finished???

A section of * Vector Display Needs work See Safety Depth Setting

I've not finished Layers. I'm going to create a Layers Properties page that will reference the waypoints, tracks, and routes Properties pages, making it fit with the three different types of pages for waypoints, tracks, and routes.
I'll then replace the Layers pages in the manual with what I have in STAGING.

The Layers pages are in the manual now and deleted from STAGING. An outstanding item that I could use help with: Layers Tab "List Contents" doesn't seem to do anything on my MacOS installation. Could someone else verify what it does, if anything?
I moved some of the more detailed info from the old Layers Tab to the Advanced User Manual/Layer Use page.

Thanks Terry. It looks good to me what you have done. When you ask for Layers Tab "List Contents" I don't know what you want me to check.exactly. I will try to attach a pdf of the page that was created.
layers_tab.pdf

@Rick Gleason The "List Contents" item on the right side of the Layers tab page doesn't change my display in any way. I saw a hint that it might change what the Waypoints Properties page displays, but it doesn't seem to make a difference in my installation. I say "seem to" because I've not been able to discern any difference in any of the displays when I change List Contents.
Terry's right - I've tried that option and got nothing as well. What's it supposed to do?

@Terry Slattery @John Morfit Please see FIXME in Layers https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:route_manager:layers_tab
I haven't checked Hakan about to see if this is working. Please remove the FIXME etc if it is working.
Can we get this FIXME completed now? Thanks.

I see that the List Contents checkbox causes the layer to appear in the Route & Mark Manager > Route Tab. But it seems that only two Route Tab functions are able to do anything with the selected layer: Center View and Activate/Deactivate. Interestingly, Reverse doesn't reverse the order in which Activate traverses the route. I think this is a deficiency.

I've updated the text for the FIXME items and removed them.

See https://github.com/OpenCPN/OpenCPN/issues/3961
Please augment to make it clear.
